Name: Fan Tan
Description:
This game is different from the card game Fan Tan.
For the Piecepack Games version, see Piecepack Fan Tan.

Stewart Culin describes it in his book "The Gambling Games of the Chinese in America" as:

"a game usually played upon a mat-covered table, with a  quantity of Chinese coins or other small objects which are covered with a cup.  The players guess what remainder will be left when the pile is divided by four, and bet upon the result.  The name means "repeatedly spreading out," and refers to the manner in which the coins or other objects are spread out upon the table."

The equipment needed to play includes:

The playing mat (called the t'an ching)
Coins, buttons, or something that is numerous and can be spread out
A cup or cover for the coins (called a t'an kun)
A rod used to separate the coins (called a t'an pong)

It takes two people to run the game, One is called the "t'an kun" (ruler of the spreading out) and the other one is called the "ho kun" who acts as a cashier.

Culin writes that the game is believed to have been invented by Kwan Chung, a renowned statesmen of antiquity who died in 645BC. Culin also mentions the likelihood that the game was invented for soldiers as a way for them to pass the time in camp.

This game is identical to the Phillipine game Capona.

Name: Au Pont de Lodi
Description:
Game description: The First Italy Campaign (1796-1797) was actually the most brilliant military expedition of the French Revolutionary Wars.The Lodi manoeuver was also, strategically thinking, a large flanking operation against Beaulieu’s army.
“Au pont de Lodi” is a simulation of the May 10, 1796 battle, which opened the way to general Bonaparte’s triumph over the Austrian Lombardische Armée, leading his Italy’s army towards the seize of Milan. The Battle of Lodi was not a decisive engagement, since the Austrian army had successfully escaped. But it became a central element in the Napoleonic myth and, according to Napoleon himself, contributed to convincing him that he was superior to other generals, and that his destiny would lead him to achieve great things.

The game uses the 'La Bataille series' rules from Clash of Arms. The Rulebook is intended to be a rough guide to tactical warfare in the last Eighteenth Century and in the beginning of the “age of Napoleon”.

Note: The series rules are not included in the game. Rules from any La Bataille game can be used or they must be downloaded. Both the full rules and the simple Marie Louise rules can be used.
Families: Series: La Bataille (Marshal Enterprises / Clash of Arms Games)

Name: Wahltag
Description:
In Wahltag, the players try to win the election for the German parliament (called Bundestag).

During their turn, the player chooses between moving their pawn to another area or performing an election campaign by throwing a die and then placing chips. During the game, results are tallied in each land and the player adds their own percentage of votes together. The game ends when all lands have been decided. The player with the most votes wins the election.

Published as Spielbox Edition No.7 in Spielbox issue 1/1994.

Name: Beint í mark
Description: A simple football (soccer game) where players roll dice to move the ball and try to score. Players can land on special spots, get yellow or red cards and so on. Penalty shoot-out is possible as well.

Name: Land O' Sugar
Description:
From the back:

Remember playing boardgames like Candyland?  You were an innocent kid with a dumb hair cut wishing so "bad" you were playing something else like "Super Colossal Master of All Elementary Schools or Ruler of All the Fudgesicles in the Freezer!"  Your super strength allowing you to flick your opponent across the orange shag carpet?  Well... Your wishes have come true.  With The Wild Wigout Comix Gameboards!

Land o' Sugar was one of seven crazy art boardgames produced by Scairy Hairy Toys, San Fransisco in the early to mid-1990s.  Each was created by a local underground artist and each was handmade, silk-screened and extremely limited.

Land o' Sugar takes the player into the wonderful world of sugar.  The game requires one pound of hard round candies to play.  It came with a brightly colored silk-screened boardgame with a pinwheel pixie spinner and three mutant sugar eating game pieces. The object of the game was to get to the end without passing out from an over-indulgence of sugar or throwing up.  The game was created by illustrator David Fremont best known for his strange comics and silk-screened concert posters.

Name: Nichts wie raus hier
Description:
Every player has 4 different pawns with values from 1 to 4. On his turn he can move one pawn so many unoccupied spaces like the value of this pawn shows. If the moved pawn is on a space with the same number as his value the player can take it from the board. The first player who gets all his pawns off the board wins.

Published in Spielbox 4/2006

Name: Awesome Bots
Description: Awesome Bots is a short card game in which you draft and then play through your deck of robot cards, battling for the best score. The structure of the game allows you to filter through what you've gotten, and you won't be playing most of what you draft. All but the lowest-valued cards have a cost, requiring you to spend cards you've already played. You must either "scrap" a certain value's worth of robots, sending them out of the game, or "upgrade" them, saving those points for later. Balancing the risky but high-valued scrapping bots and the safer but less rewarding upgrading bots, keeping in mind the values and types in your deck's makeup, is central to the game. The game can be played cutthroat with 2 to 4 players or as a partners game of 2 on 2.

Name: Global Warming
Description: This is a slowly sinking island game like Survive: Escape from Atlantis! or Atlantis. It uses a unique method for determining which parts of the island will sink next that gives the players partial knowledge of future events.

Name: Civil War "Blast from the Past"
Description:
Civil War "Blast from the Past" is a game for children.  It involves a 32 page booklet that contain the rules, assorted trivia of the Civil War and most importantly, the answers to the questions on the cards in the game!

It is a game where you move to a space and according to what the space is that you landed on, you pick up a card.  This can result in moving further, hampering your opponent or answering a trivia question.

There are also several sets of stickers that come with the game that are placed on a small map showing decisive battles of the Civil War.

Name: Ellipse
Description:
From the Instruction booklet:

"ELLIPSE has a simple premise, but unusual tactics that you will enjoy for minutes at a time, or for repeated ROUND AFTER ROUND OF FUN!!"

Game includes
-vinyl roll up board (similar to vinyl chess mats)
-48 "jewels" in primary color (glass beads)
-2 "jewels" in secondary color for alternate "8 ball" rules.

The board features a series of circles and ellipses all intersecting at tangents and perpendiculars.  Players take turns removing jewels from one shape (circle, or ellipse).  The player who takes the last jewel loses.  Strategy involves controlling the number removed on your turn by selecting intersecting shapes to either increase or decrease the number you take that turn, thus hopefully forcing your opponent to take the final piece.

Name: Emergency Action
Description: This roll-and-move game is designed to teach players about first aid.  Each turn, the current player rolls a special die (featuring the numbers 1 through 4, a plus, and a minus).  If a number is rolled, the player moves forward; pluses are re-rolled, and minuses cause a turn to be lost.  Some spaces have special actions (roll again, go back to start, etc.), while others require the player to answer a question about first aid.  If the player is unable to answer correctly, he or she must stay on the square and continue answering questions on subsequent turns until successful.  Special "first aid station" spaces give "first aid fact" cards which may be used as references when answering questions.  The first player to make it all the way around the board wins.

Name: Battlewagons: Tactical Naval Combat in the World War II Era, 1920-1945
Description:
Battlewagons is a complete standalone game.  It employs the Battleship Captain game system of swift naval combat, and the rules and components of the two designs are fully compatible.  If you own  Battleship Captain, you already have all the components contained in Battlewagons.

Scenarios include:

Denmark Strait, May 1941
Death of the Bismarck, May 1941
Battle of the River Plate, Dec 1939
Hypothetical Italian Sortie
Tirpitz sortie (hypothetical)
US vs. Japan (hypothetical)
Design your own

Contents:

Rules booklet
2 sheets of ship counters (British, German, French, Italian, American and Japanese)
one sheet of game markers
Reference Card
scenarios

Included in:


    Battleship Captain


Preceded by:


    Tsushima: Tactical Naval Combat in the Pre-Dreadnought Era, 1890-1906
    Grand Fleet: Tactical Naval Combat in the Dreadnought Era, 1906-1919


Includes a complimentary copy of Salvo!.

Name: Tsushima: Tactical Naval Combat in the Pre-Dreadnought Era, 1890-1906
Description:
Tsushima is a complete standalone game.  It employs the Battleship Captain game system of swift naval combat, and the rules and components of the two designs are fully compatible.  If you own  Battleship Captain, you already have all the components contained in Tsushima.

Scenarios include:

Tsushima
Tsushima (variant)
Britain vs. Germany or France (hypothetical)
Rule Britannia (hypothetical)
Pacific Supremacy (hypothetical)
Design your own

Contents:

Rules booklet
2 sheets of ship counters
one sheet of game markers
Reference Card
scenarios

Included in:


    Battleship Captain


Followed by:


    Grand Fleet: Tactical Naval Combat in the Dreadnought Era, 1906-1919
    Battlewagons: Tactical Naval Combat in the World War II Era, 1920-1945


Includes a complimentary copy of Salvo!

Name: Grand Fleet: Tactical Naval Combat in the Dreadnought Era, 1906-1919
Description:
Grand Fleet is a complete standalone game.  It employs the Battleship Captain game system of swift naval combat, and the rules and components of the two designs are fully compatible.  If you own  Battleship Captain, you already have all the components contained in Grand Fleet.

Scenarios include:

Dogger Bank, Jan 1915
Falklands, Dec 1914
Goeben vs. Cruiser Squadron, Aug 1914
Nation vs. Nation (hypothetical)
Design your own

Contents:

Rules booklet
2 sheets of ship counters (British, French, German, Italian)
one sheet of game markers
Reference Card
scenarios

Included in:


    Battleship Captain


Preceded by:


    Tsushima: Tactical Naval Combat in the Pre-Dreadnought Era, 1890-1906


Followed by:


    Battlewagons: Tactical Naval Combat in the World War II Era, 1920-1945


Includes a complimentary copy of Salvo!.

Name: Äpfel und Birnen
Description:
Every player starts with one dishes pawn and three scoring pawns (respectively one for pears, green and red apples).

The board shows 36 dishes with apples and pears. At the borders are scoring tracks for red and green apples coming - from the left side of the board - and for pears - coming from the right side of the board.

On ones turn all players play one subsurfaced card. The highest card goes to the start player, the second highest to his left neighbor.

Now all players play the cards in front of them in sequence. First a player moves his dishes pawn according to his card. After this he can move one of his three scoring pawns in order to get more points for each.

The play ends when one player moves his pear scoring pawn on the same field of one of his apple pawns. The players now count all points for their three scoring pawns together. The player with the highest number of points wins.

Äpfel und Birnen is Number 74 of Edition Spielbox published in issue 2/2006.

Name: Quebec: je me souviens
Description: In this trivia game, explore Quebec province by trying to answer questions in 6 categories: history, culture, science, geography, sport and misc.

Name: Quebec in a box
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly variant based on Quebec City.
Families: Series: ... in a Box (Late for the Sky)

Name: Zombeja! Ovella!
Description:
Zombeja! Ovella! is Finnish language storytelling boardgame for 3-6 players, One game takes about 30 minutes per player.

Like in most traditional roleplaying games each session starts with creation of character concept. Zombeja! Ovella! utilizes "charactersticks", short wooden sticks with different qualities like personality types and generalizations printed on them to create instant stereotypes suited for genre.

Game combines competitive and co-operative play elements in storytelling to produce a structured roleplaying exercise that simulates thematic elements of survival horror movies.

Players have to create conflict of interest to eliminate other players and to advance their own position on the board. Co-operation of others is required to survive but some need to be sacrificed.

Originally a free mini-game with issue #8 of Finnish language roleplaying games magazine Roolipelaaja the game was released later packaged in VHS tape case to make it look indie zombie flick.

Zombeja! Ovella! is predecessor to English language game  Zombie Cinema which essentially streamlined version of it.

Name: Cognition
Description:
From the publisher:

What type of thinker are you?  Are you a lateral thinker, a critical thinker, instinctive or destructive?  Would you describe yourself as creative or deductive?  A Mr Spock type or more like The Riddler?  Does your approach to life mirror the sharp analysis of Sherlock Holmes, or the poetry of Shakespeare?

No matter what your style, Cognition is a game that is guaranteed to test your mental stamina and tickle your funny bone in equal measure!

Ask yourself, how well do you know the person sitting next to you? Are your ESP powers in good shape?  Perhaps you’re a whiz at solving codes but do you have any idea what your car number plate is?  You might be as wise as Yoda, but do you know the names of Frank Zappa’s first two children?

So, if you can combine strategy with smarts, have a bit of luck, can manipulate others without them realizing it, have a knack for languages and a memory for things everyone else has forgotten they ever knew, you’re on your way to becoming a Cognition master!

Name: Ísland: íslenska spurningaspilið
Description: A trivia game about Iceland. There are six categories of questions: History, culture, nature, geography, sports and miscellaneous. Collect a token from each category to win. The players roll a die to move and then they must answer a question from the category they land on. If they answer correctly they get a token and when they've gathered tokens in every colour, they can head to the capital (center). First they need to get to a corner of the board where they answer a question of their own choosing. Then there are two coloured spaces from the corner to the center. When the players get to the center they answer a question of the other player(s) choosing. A correct answer in the center means victory!

Name: Landhelgisspilið
Description: This game is all about the struggle between Iceland and the United Kingdom during the 50's - when Iceland was expanding it's territorial waters by increments.

Name: O Desafio
Description:
O Desafio (Portuguese for "The Challenge"): A crosswords game.

This game is similar Scrabble. 
The goal of the game is, using letter pieces, to form words in a crossword layout to archieve the most number of points.

Name: Tornado vs. Trailer Park
Description:
It’s tornado season again in ‘Tornado Alley’ in America’s heartland. As residents of Piecepack Flats Trailer Park, you are often at the mercy of Mother Nature’s fury. Watch as tornadoes snake their way towards your mobile home and cross your fingers that your trailer remains unscathed.

Tornado vs. Trailer Park is a game for the piecepack game system.

Rules can be found on Piecepack Wiki

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

Name: Pursuit of Happiness
Description: A card game using standard cards that gives players a unique way of making melds.  In addition, the melds in each suit have different abilities.  Diamond melds let you acquire more cards; Spade melds let you attack your opponent's melds; Club melds let you defend against attacks; and Heart melds give you happiness, which is the goal of the game.  A good mix of luck and skill that has a different feel than most card games.  Plays best with 3 or 4 players.

Name: Rally Point Volume 3
Description:
Rally Point 3 is a scenario pack.  It is an annual release, usually at the ASLOK convention in the fall.  It includes a "Words from the Editor" column and a brief description of each scenario, but does not include the magazine articles seen in Sherry Enterprises' Schwerpunkt issues.

From the Sherry Enterprises web site:

Rally Point Volume 3 is a collection of new scenarios, hand-picked from the Schwerpunkt archives. These 10 scenarios are presented in the Schwerpunkt easy-to-read format on high-quality cardstock.

RPT21 Gotterdammerung!:  Waidhoffen, Germany, 9 May 1945: German infantry, PzIVJs and a Jagdtiger are desperately trying to escape to the grasp of a Company of T34/85s. Can the Germans destroy their own vehicles and escape? This tense tournament action is set on half boards 4, 42, 44, and 47. Game Length: 4.5 turns.

RPT22 Convente Beato Sante: Mombaroccio, Italy, 26 August 1944: Canadians infantry and Churchill IVs must clear a reinforced German platoon from a half-board 15 hilltop pillbox/trench complex. Game Length: 4.5 turns.

RPT23 The Bavent Recce:  Normandy, France, 9 June 1944: A Canadian Airborne platoon must clear check points and find a German mortar platoon, while avoiding casualties. This tense tournament action portray one of ASLs rarest situations- the reconnaissance patrol. This scenario uses board 24. Game Length: 4.5 turns.

RPT24 Farmyard Affray:  Normandy, France, 7 June 1944: Canadian Airborne conducts a raid on a board 42, German-occupied farm and and then must withdraw, while a German PzIVH and infantry pursue them. This is tournament action at its finest. Game Length: 5 turns.

RPT25 Cornwalls' Rum Ration:  Bruggerhof, Germany, 19 November 1944: German infantry supported by StuG IIIGs and a FlaK Pz IV/37 must make a tough choice is this split objective attack on a British defended village set on boards 22 and 42.  Game Length: 4.5 turns.

RPT26 A Cross In Gold: Gunstett, Germany, 16 March 1945: This is the big honkin' scenario of the pack in which American infantry, Shermans and M-10 GMCs must cross a stream under fire and establish a bridgehead in the face of a determined group of Germans supported by Jagdtigers. This scenario uses boards 41 and 50. Game Length: 6.5 turns.

RPT27 Sycamore And Succotash: Namur, Kwajalein Atoll. 1 February 1944: U.S. Maries storm a Japanese held island (board 49) and have nearly cleared it when a torpedo magazine explodes. Can you clear the Japanese out of their bunker before the torpedoes explode? Game Length: 5.5 turns.

RPT28 Polozkov Push: Kirpercheny, Romanian Bessarabia, 6 April 1944: The Russian 170th Tank Brigade with T-34/M43s and SU-85s try to penetrate German screening force of infantry Panthers and PzIVs and exit. This scenario is set on boards 17 and 44. Game Length: 6.5 turns.

RPT29 The Sound Of Hoof Beats: Mielewo-Glinki Region, East Prussia, 2 September 1939: Mike Faulkner designed this Polish cavalry attack on a German defended village set on boards v and 12. Game Length: 6.5 turns.

RPT30 Knocking On The Front Door: Narva, U.S.S.R., 14 March 1944: Brian Williams designed this Russian Guards attack supported by KV-1Ss and T-70s. German SS units must try to defend a cemetery and church on boards 53 and 54. Game Length: 5.5 turns.

Name: Melee Pack I
Description:
SoCal ASL is one of the older ASL clubs and has been involved with the testing and development of products for Heat of Battle, Bounding Fire Productions, MMP, Front Line Productions and Kinetic Energy.   In 2003 they finally produced a scenario set of their own.  Melee Pack 1 includes six scenarios and also comes with 5 cheat sheets for the AFV's used in the scenarios.   The scenario cards are in full color.

The scenarios include:

MP1: THE WOLF'S LAST TOOTH

January 17, 1941 Klisura, Albania:
The remnants of the Wolves of Tuscany Division must break out through the thin infantry lines held by the ELAS
Militia and the Greek 15th Division with only a handful of tankettes for support.

MP2: CURTAIN KALL

November 6, 1944 Hürtgen Forest, Germany:
Task Force Ripple must utilize its inexperienced GIs, tanks and TDs to smash the dug in soldaten of the German
89th Infantry Division. Add in a little heavy caliber OBA and the Americans just might have a chance.

MP3: HOLY GROUND

November 6, 1944 Vossenack, Germany:
The 156th PanzerGrenadiers have the U.S. 112th Infantry on the run. The 2nd Battalion CP must cobble together a
defense around the town church or lose Vossenack entirely.

MP4: BLEEDING THE FIRST

November 16, 1944 Hamich, Germany:
The 1st Battalion of the 16th Infantry has been ordered to take Hamich. The elite 48th Grenadiers are waiting for
them in the wooded approaches to the town where they’ve been preparing defenses for weeks.

MP5: THE RATS OF HAMICH

November 18, 1944 Hamich, Germany:
The 3rd Battalion of the 16th Infantry now leads the assault on Hamich. The 48th Grenadiers have set up a layered
and well-hidden defense to make them pay for every muddy yard.

MP6: THE MARNACH STRONGPOINT

December 16, 1944 Marnach, Luxembourg:
The 2nd Panzer Division must coordinate an armored assault to seize Marnach from the reconstituted U.S. 110th.
Though surprised, the 110th may have just enough force to halt the German advance.

Name: Ben 10 Alien Force Web Cardz
Description:
Based on the Cartoon Network series, Ben 10 Alien Force Web Cardz is a modular board game, where players place tiles from their hand to build the board that their character then travels, activating tiles as they move around the board.

The decks of tiles can be customized, and an online play element is included.

Name: AT-43: Operation Damocles Campaign Book
Description:
Operation Damocles describes new missions as well as new special rules. This campaign is divided into three phases, one for each level of the factory world. Each phase is composed of four "priority" missions, covering the development of the operation and the conditions on Damocles.

This book also contains the official errata for AT-43.

This campaign uses the rules from AT-43: The Rulebook and the Army Books.

Name: Sportz Dice Cricket
Description: Cricket with dice. Make lists of both teams, with names of all batters and bowlers. The opening bowler rolls the "bowling" dice, that is the dice with 1,2,3,4,6 & "HOWZAT" on it. The batting team scores 1,2,3,4 or 6 runs until "HOWZAT" is rolled. The batsban then rolls the "BATTING" dice to determine the result of the "appeal". One bowler rolls the bowling dice until one batsman is out. The next bowler rolls until the next batman is out. The next team takes their turn, and the winner is the team with most runs at end of 2 innings.

Name: Megadeal
Description: Megadeal is a business game for 2 to 6 players aged 10 and over. Players take turns to throw the dice and move around the board obeying the instructions as they go. Players can decide to buy property or invest in an enterprise opportunity. Property enables the player to collect rent. Enterprises can either succeed or fail. The first player to gain wealth of £1,000,000 is the winner.

Name: Le Défifoo bleu
Description:
Each player has to cross the 5 continents by placing continents cards in front of him.
The first player to reach that goal wins the game.
Players can also play negative cards to slow down or stop other players progression.

Game Components: a blue velvet bag, 110 charts, 1 , 1 score notebook, 1 pencil.

Name: Spacefarer Starship Simulator
Description:
Spacefarer Starship Simulator allows you to design your own starship right down to the weapon systems, power system, living area, armor and personnel.
The movement system allows for three dimensional combat and allows play on any surface without need of maps, hex fields etc.
A free print and play game that allows as many players as desired to play.

Name: Quebec opoly
Description:
This is a French Canadian version of Monopoly where all the properties have been replaced by popular places or events in Quebec.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Cinema en France
Description:
A variation of the original Trivial Pursuit game, this one is all about answering questions about French cinema, from the past 5 decades and more!

Contents:
-1 board game
-500 question-and-answer cards
-2 card-holder boxes
-1 die
-6 "camembert cheese" tokens
-36 colored triangle markers
-1 rulebook

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Sport en France
Description: With more than 3000 questions in 6 different categories, this game is all about answering questions about the sports in France and be the first to accumulate 6 colored triangle tokens!

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Gastronomie en France
Description: A regional variation of the Trivial Pursuit game, this one focus on asking and answering questions about french food.

Name: Pro Football's Extreme Gameday Trivia
Description: This trivia game is played on a game board that looks like a football field.  Each question is aimed at making you do different plays of the football game so you can advance on the field.  About 2000 questions covering the last decades of pro football, and the company even offer free update cards to keep the game current.

Name: Mr. Lincoln's War: Regimental Combat in the American Civil War
Description:
Regimental level miniature rules for the American Civil War. Does not require rebasing, works with any miniature scale.
Designed originally for 15mm.  Two spin-offs from original:  War against George III (AWI Period)  Mr. Polk's War. (Mexican American War)  In design now using same system: The War of James the First.

Name: Magnewand
Description:
On a player's turn, the dice are rolled to determine how many magnets must be moved to the center pit.  These are moved by means of the metal wand.  The required number of magnets must be dropped in the pit in a single trip -- if more or fewer magnets find their way to the pit in a single attempt the player scores no points.  Likewise, if the player drops any magnets along the way no points are scored.

Magnets are assigned 15, 10 or 5 points each, depending on their size (the larger the magnet, the more points it is worth).  The first player to 500 wins.

Name: Forward March
Description:
Forward March is an educational game teaching music theory that can be played as a board or a card game with 2-6 players, partners or teams.

Over 250 questions on notes, intervals, chords, key signatures, scales, meter and music vocabulary are for three different levels of play from early elementary to intermediate.  When questions are answered correctly pieces move around a board and the first person to space 32 wins.

Name: Face of Emoch
Description:
This card game is included as a bonus at the end of Points in Space 1, an RPG supplement. The card deck consists of 54 cards, each depicting part of the visage of the mad alien god Emoch: the left eye, the right eye, the left gova (tentacle-like horn), the right gova, or the maw.

Various hands are ranked. The best hand is Granmung's Death, consisting of five maw cards.

The card art was drawn by Dan Smith. The cards contain text both in English and in alien script.

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Finland '39-'40-The Winter War
Description: Ten scenarios and four campaigns set in Finland during the Winter War of 1939-40. The Orders of Battle are written to be compatible with several miniatures rules including Battleground, Beer and Pretzels Skirmish (BAPS), BattleFront, Overlord, TAC:Skirmish, Skirmish '90 and The Face of Battle.

Name: Colonial Campaigns: The Zulu War, 1879
Description:
From the back of the book:

Zulu War, 1879 features 11 action-packed historical scenarios from the British conquest of Zululand. Staunch British Redcoats, Colonial Cavalry, The Naval Brigade, Lancers, Highlanders and a host of Zulu warriors battle for the survival of one of Africa's premier native states.

The scenarios:
1. Sihayo's Kraal - January, 1879
2. Isandlwana - January 22, 1879
3. Rorke's Drift - January 22, 1879
4. The Battle of iNyezane River - January 22, 1879
5. The Battle of iNtombi Drift - March 12, 1879
6. Hlobane - March 28, 1879
7. The Battle of Khambula - March 29, 1879
8. Gingindhlovu - April 2, 1879
9. The 17th Lancers at Zungeni - June 5, 1879
10. Across the White Mfolozi - July 3, 1879
11. Last Stand at Ulundi - July 4th, 1879

The scenarios are all organized to be played using The Sword and the Flame, but can easily be adapted to any rules set. Units are set at 8 figures instead of the traditional 20. This allows for faster play, greater flexibility and .. your 20-figure unit becomes 2½ units instantly! Play is on a 4' x 6' table. Give it a try!

Other sections include:
- History of the Zulu War
- Information on the British and Zulu Armies
- Bibliography
- Revised Sword and the Flame charts
Families: Game: The Sword and the Flame

Name: The Sword in North Africa Event Deck
Description:
This is a set of event cards for The Sword in North Africa variant of The The Sword and the Flame miniatures game. There are events for the French Foreign Legion as well as their enemies. The deck is similar to The Sword and the Flame Event Deck, but has events more suitable for TSINA battles.

A sheet explaining the use of the cards in a game is included.
Families: Game: The Sword and the Flame

Name: Cykelspurten
Description:
Cykelspurten is game for 2-6 players from 6 years and up. The game is about getting home on your bicycle - without getting hurt during the trip.
That's why you have to use hand signals and be aware of the traffic during the trip and further more to get the right equipment for your bike. (the bicycle cards)
Each player has his wn bicycle and a set of cards which is dealt at the start of the game.

On your way home you can encounter unpredicted challenges or surprises when you reach the police or !-places on the board. If you reach a bicycle store, you can draw a card from one of the other players.

Name: Stora Bostadsspelet
Description:
The players start with a one-room apartment each which they will renovate, improve and sell when the market is at its best.

The players will continue doing this until they have enough money to buy their dream apartment and win the game.

Name: CSI: Crime Game – Booster Pack #2
Description: This booster pack contains three new stories: "House Built On Lies", "Removed From Office" and "Writer's Block."  It can be played on its own or in conjunction with the original CSI boardgame.
Families: TV Shows: CSI – Crime Scene Investigation

Name: Flames of War: Fortress Europe
Description:
Fortress Europe is a supplement (or "intelligence handbook") for the World War II miniatures game Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game.  It covers the period of January to August 1944 ("Late War" in the game's parlance), and details the forces available to the major combatants engaged along the European Eastern and Western Fronts (namely, the Germans, British, Americans, and Soviets).

Fortress Europe is described by the publisher as updating (rather than outright replacing) the previously published intelligence handbook Flames of War: Festung Europa (Late War 1944).  Festung Europa covered the exact same period and (essentially) the same forces.  Accordingly, there is a significant amount of overlap between the two books.  There are, however, notable changes; some point values have been adjusted and some units and special rules have been added, for example.

Released on November 15, 2008, Fortress Europe is a softcover book containing 160 full-color pages.  At its release, it retailed (in the United States) for $40.

Product Spotlight

Name: Larger Than Life: The Game of Pulp Adventures
Description:
SO WHAT ARE THE PULPS?

It’s spaceships, jungle lords, and Nazis. Lost cities, underwater adventure, and maybe even a hard-boiled detective or two.

It’s about heroes moving from scene to scene at breakneck speed. Hot on the trail or maybe a step in front of the bad guys.

It’s clever cliffhangers that leave you wanting more.

But mostly it’s all about the story.

And that’s what drives Larger Than Life. In LTL you step into the story and become a Larger Than Life Hero. LTL moves you from scene to scene each with a different challenge. Complete your challenge and move to the next scene. Fail and you’re whisked down another road that leads to who knows where. But if you stick to it and if you’re lucky you’ll complete all the challenges and that will get you what you wanted from the beginning, a shot at the “Big Bad”. The Big Bad, the Evil Genius, or the Villain…we prefer to call him the Yin to your Yang because without the “Big Bad” there’s no story. And it’s all about the story. Welcome to the world of....Larger Than Life!

Name: Munchkin Quest: Promo Set 1
Description:
From the publisher:
Free! One Troll Booth, complete with Troll!

Munchkin Quest Promo Set 1 is a little bonus for MQ fans. It includes a new room, a new monster, and a new kind of link, all in a single sheet.

The room is the Troll Booth, and the monster is, of course, the classic Troll. It's only level 10, but it has three treasures if you defeat it!

The links are Junky Passages. It takes 2 movement points to pass through . . . but you might find gold among the junk!

Expands: Munchkin Quest

Name: Balaton Rt.
Description:
In this game with a somewhat Monopoly-like board, the properties are villages around the Lake Balaton. The rules include instructions for eight different games (some quite different from Monopoly) to be played with subsets of the components.

Lake Balaton is a freshwater lake in the Transdanubian region of Hungary.

Name: Stratum
Description:
From the publisher:

Strategy skills get stepped up a notch when space runs out on the board. Then the game continues on top of the previously played pieces! Following specific layering laws, each player tries to cover up their opponent's pieces. In the end, the more exposed player comes out the winner.

Name: Munchkin 1.5: Kości zostały rzucone
Description:
This mini-expansion, released only in Polish, contains 30 cards and a red Wicked Munchkin Die. Most of the cards have been taken from Munchkin Dice and Munchkin Rigged Demo, but 5 new cards have been designed just for this expansion.

Expands:

     Munchkin


Part of the Munchkin series.

Name: Norwegian SS-zombies
Description:
This expansion to Nuke Norway Now adds a third player.

Adolf Quisling, Vidkun Quislings until recently known child, Has made himself immortal with genetic experiments and learned the secret of raising the dead.  
This is a new game system for the Zombie-player -- The Zombie-player doesn't use points, he moves every zombie. From the start Adolf Quisling has no zombies and no  power. But when Sweden & Norway attack each other, all killed units are exchanged for Zombies in empty squares. A normal zombie-unit (A small group of zombies) has only 1Attack 1Defence 2Move, but if the human players let the zombies join forces they get stronger and stronger and Adolf Quisling's Raise-dead power increases.

Expands:

    Nuke Norway Now


NukeNorwayNow 50 €
Norwegian SS-zombies 25 €
or
NNN+N-SS-zombies 70 €

Name: Pride Cycle
Description:
This game is based on the Pride Cycle as described in the Book of Mormon.  The righteous are blessed and prosper, they begin to love money more than God and become wicked.  The final phase is when they are humbled, and they become righteous once more.
The aim of the game is to have the largest presence in the Book of Mormon lands.
 No dice - simple 'Rock, Scissors, Paper' style conflict, (in this case it is Army, Settlement, Preaching) with different actions for 'winning' with each action.

An additional mechanic means that as players progress around the pride cycle which encircles the map territories, the resolution of 'draws' is altered by the relative positions on the pride cycle.

Name: Galaxy Trucker: Bonus Cards
Description:
Those who pre-ordered the game for Essen Spiel 07 received 2 bonus flight cards, which add even more variety to the game.

The Bonus cards are included in Galaxy Trucker: The Big Expansion.

What to Do with Them

Leave the bonus cards out of your first game. There is no sense in making the first game too complicated, and you can look forward to using them.

The first time you decide to include the bonus cards, we recommend adding them to the Round 3 flight cards. This will give you 18 instead of 16, but you can be certain that they will turn up. This will make Round 3 a bit longer and more intense.

In later games, put them into decks II and III. That means they might show up or they might not, just like any other card.

http://czechgames.com/en/galaxy-trucker/bonuses/

Expands:

    Galaxy Trucker

Name: Number Tic-Tac-Toe
Description: Variation of the traditional Tic-Tac-Toe, One player uses the odd number between 1 to 9 and the other player uses the even numbers between 2 to 8. The odd number player goes first. The winner is the player who completes a row of three numbers that add up to 15.

Name: Warcards
Description:
Romanian language fantasy collectible card game. First commercial Romanian CCG. Design inspired from Magic: the Gathering but followed its own distinctive path. Three sets published as boosters, plus some separately sold 'mercenary' cards. Deck styles with different restrictions: Kings, Races, Warbands. Had a small, active tournament that took place in major Romanian cities.

Development ceased in 2007. A new English language virtual CCG using its original art was in development by the same team, but at some point it was scrapped.

Name: WILD ANIMALS, Educational Games
Description:
An educational Game for school and home
Content: 55 cards with animals and their description in 2 chapters:
A: uses, habits, characteristics
B: Their peculiarities
It can be played in 2 different types:

-The  active player tries to get pairs of animals by naming his animal and asking another player if he/she has an animal with the same description. 
With the peculiarities in chapter 2 on the cards the players can learn the different forms of the same attribute of animals.
-The active player reads aloud one peculiarity of one of his cards in his hand and all the other players try to guess the name of the animal. If they don´t find it he reads a second peculiarity, and so on.

Name: Maya
Description:
Maya is a game for one player. You have to find the right treasure chest by going through a labyrinth. 
You start at one of the seven rooms and have to pass all other rooms. The difficulty is that every passing room changes the rules your movement. 
For example: If you leave the room of the rabbit you may walk only right or left but never straight forward through the labyrinth.

This game was published as Spielbox Edition No.24 in Spielbox issue 6/1996.

Name: Il Gioco del Giro
Description: Italian cycling game published in May 1964 about the Giro d'Italia. The game is played over 6 stages, the track of each stage is composed by parts that can be put in a different order and it includes mountains. There are 2 dice in the game: a white one that determines movement and a green one that triggers events. The winner of the game gets the pink jersey?

Name: Buzzy Bee's Garden Game
Description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to fill your garden with ten flowers.

Choose a corner garden spot on the board in which to plant your flowers. Take ten flowers.

If the spinner points to one, two, three, four, or five flowers, take that number of flowers and plant them in your garden. If the spinner stops on the worm you must take out one flower. If the the spinner stops on two beetles then you must take out two flowers.If the spinner stops on the shovel then you must take all the flowers in your garden away.

The first player to plant all of his flowers and say "buzz buzz" wins the game.

Name: Wee Shapes
Description:
Most of the skills associated with successful learning in the early years are related to a child's general discriminating abilities and his intellectual problem-solving abilities.  Playing Wee Shapes will help children Ages 3 - 7 to sharpen their skills in discriminating shapes by sight and by touch.  Tackling the central problem of the game will provide a pleasant setting to learn how certain games problems can best be solved.

As your child plays Wee Shapes he will learn to match and sort different shapes and to replicate patterns made of these shapes.  Help our child progress from simple sorting and matching to more complex disciminating and pattern-copying by starting with the pattern sheets and advancing to the color-picture cards.

Name: Tour de France
Description: Early cycling themed game.  The board consisted of 10 cards measuring 12.5x23.5cm., they were put next to each other to form a track.

Name: Le Jeu du Tour de France Spirou
Description:
Belgian cycling game about the Tour de France released in June 1960.

This roll and move game inspired by the Game of Goose was published in four consecutive issues of Spirou (issues 1158 to 1161) during the summer of 1960.

The game is played in multiple stages covering the full Tour. For each stage, a common track and common rules are used for the first 80 squares. However, the last 20 squares of each stage are played on different tracks using different rules and some stages are played with completely different rule sets. Time trials, for example, turn into timed dexterity contests. Points are earned for every stage and overall rankings are tabulated.

Name: I Campionati Mondiali di Ciclismo
Description: Italian game published in September 1964. For it's time it had an original and excellent rule set. The game consisted of 2 different races, run at an indoor track. The Velocita (Sprint) race was run like a tournament with different legs and cyclists competing head to head. The 2nd race, called Mezzo Fondo a Motoro, runs over 4 or 8 laps, any number of teams can participate in that race and the cyclists have to follow a derny<sic> there.

Name: Il Gioco del Tour
Description: Italian cycling game about the Tour de France published in June 1961.

Name: I Campionati del Mondo di Ciclismo
Description:
Italian indoor cycling game published in August 1967.
Movement is not determined by dice but by counters although there is a die in the game but that is used to win counters instead of to advance on the track. There are three kind of counters: a red one for energy, a yellow one for sprint (they can only be played in the upper corners) and a blue one for a burst of speed. There are 4 different races in the game: Velocita (Sprint), Inseguimento (Pursuit), Traguardi (Points race) and Eliminazione (an elimination race).

Name: Bible Heroes
Description:
3 Bible Heroes Games

(c)1963 Warner Press

Contains three separate game boards featuring St. Paul, St. Peter, and David vs. Goliath. Players move along a track that features Biblical illustrations. Each illustration features a matching Bible verse.

Also includes a plastic storage box containing 12 colored tokens.

"Bible Journeys for children Ages 4 - 14"

Name: New York City Visions
Description:
"City Visions includes 400 beautiful photographs, thousands of interesting questions & facts and a hip City Map. The team to guess the most answers and 'capture' the most locations on the City Map wins!"

Contains 400 cards, washable folding map board, dry marker, playing tray, and rules.

Name: Euroraces
Description: A table board game that was created by the Bank of Greece to promote the usage and knowledge of the new European currency called "Euro".  The players are given cash in various denominations, and the object of the game is to visit as many as European destinations as possible and spend all the cash.  The back of the board illustrates all the coinage and paper bill denominations of the new currency.  The entire description is in greek language.

Name: Clovis
Description: In CLOVIS players represent hunter-gatherer bands of North America in 12,000 B.C. Players send out hunting parties to kill big game. This earns players points. Players may increase the numbers in their bands thus allowing them to kill more big game. There are specialty cards that modify the regular flow of things as well. The big game grow extinct as the game progresses. The game starts with 8 big game cards available in round 1 and only 1 big game card available for the final (8th) round.

Name: Crazy Office
Description: Will you be able to survive in the craziest office in the world with clumsy colleagues and awkward situations. To be able to "survive" you will have to use all your diplomatic skills: the ability to come out from difficult situations, to appear good to you bosses, to make your colleagues guilty ... like in a real office. Crazy Office will test your diplomatic and dialectic skills

Name: Sandokan: La Tigre della Malesia
Description:
Simple Italian game for children, from TV cartoons in late '90.
Interestingly, movement is determine by use of chips.
Each player plays the role of Sandokan. 
He must reach the fortress where Marianna is trapped, set her free and return back to Monpracen. 
The first to do this wins the game.

Name: DBMM Army Lists Book 2: 500 BC to 476 AD
Description: The second book of army lists for Phil Barker's DBMM with conversion notes for DBM. A total of 84 lists are included.

Name: BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules
Description:
Another volume in the Classic Battletech core rules series, Strategic Operations focuses on "forces in solar system" (as opposed to "forces on world" for Tactical Operations and the even-wider-ranging scope of the forthcoming Interstellar Operations). This book's main sections consist of general rules covering a variety of topics (including a system for abstracted aerospace gaming); rules for advanced aerospace movement, combat, and unit construction; maintenance, repair, salvage, and customization rules; and miniatures rules (as opposed to using miniatures on a standard hex maps).

A significant portion of the volume is taken up with standard and advanced rules for a revised version of Battleforce 2, a fast-playing game system amenable to mass combat. Rules for converting standard Battletech units to Battleforce are also included.

Strategic Operations updates not only Battleforce but also AeroTech 2, integrating both into the current rules framework.

Expands:
BattleTech
BattleTech: Total Warfare

Re-implements:
Battleforce 2
AeroTech 2

Name: Monopoly: My MLB Edition
Description:
Inroducing the first ever Monopoly game you customize!  Choose 22 of the 30 Major League Baseball teams and place them on the board.

Then . . . buy, sell and trade your favorite teams in an effort to control Major League Baseball, a baseball fan's fantasy.  The team labels are removeable and reusable so, if you choose, you can play a different game each time.

Create It . . . Play It . . . Own It All!

Name: Hyperbolic Chess
Description:
In this game, the rules of chess are exactly the same, but the geometry is completely different.  As long as you carefully follow the rules for the movement of the pieces, you will be O.K., but the geometry of a concave surface can make things confusing.

Two lines can intersect in more than one point.  That means that a queen has two different ways to get from point A to point B.  A bishop can change colors and you can even end up with two bishops on the same color.  A rook in the center of the board controls two adjacent rows.  If a knight is near the center, it can land on the same color as the square it left.

You can win by either checkmating an opponent or by taking enough pieces of value from your opponents before being checkmated.  Thus, aggressive play is often rewarded.  There is a small score board with wooden discs to keep track of points earned (better pieces are worth more points).

Name: Shove piecepack
Description:
Shove Ha'penny is a traditional British pub (tavern) game of dexterity and skill dating from the the mid
19th Century, with earlier variants in existence as early as the 15th Century. It is still widely played
today. Shove piecepack is an adaptation of this fun game for all ages.

It adds a new definition to the piecepack glossary:

Shove (v.): to propel/push an object (overhanging the edge of a table) along a smooth surface, by hitting it with the heel of one’s hand.

Rules can be found on Piecepack Wiki

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

Name: Ahoy, Matey!
Description: Ahoy, Matey! is a rip-roaring pirate adventure for ye olde piecepack. It has been ported and adapted from Scott Peterson's web-infamous 'Pirateer'. It is a fun mix of luck, luck, luck and skill for all of the family. There are almost endless variants that you can use to spice the game up even further. The object is to collect the treasure with one of your ships and move it to the Ace coin in your harbor.

Name: A Knight's Tale
Description:
"What say you, Brave Knight?". A piecepack port of Joe Huber's Joust (in theme of Heath Ledger's "A Knight's Tale"). A Fast-paced, very simple, and fun game. There is a slight element of strategy (in the style of Rock, Paper, Scissors). The game is perfect to kick-start a gaming session.

Pre-programmed movement and attacks lead to interesting strategy!

Rules can be found on Piecepack Wiki

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

Name: ran: SAT.1-Fußballquiz
Description: ran - SAT.1-Fußballquiz is a trivia game about football, respectively soccer. In their turns, the players throw a dice, move across the board and answer one out of 999 questions concerning football. The one, who reaches the finish first and can answer three questions consecutively is the winner.

Name: Thomas The Tank Engine Game
Description:
Two, three or four engines collect their trains and race to the seaside.

Make a complete train of one engine and three trucks or carriages by collecting from two sidings and a third at a station.  Who will win by having the first train to arrive at the seaside station?

Simple roll and move game for children based on the popular books and TV show.
Families: TV Shows: Thomas the Tank Engine

Name: Mr Bump's Apple Picking Game
Description:
Mr Bump's job is picking apples.  He does it by bumping into apple trees, that's why this game is named after him.  The object of the game is to "Bump" all the apples from the tree and when the last apple has been picked the player with the most apples is the winner.

Each player sits facing one of the four 'apple tubs'.  All apples are placed round the tree playing surface just like apples on a tree.  Each player spins the spinner and takes or puts back apples from the tree or his tub as directed by where the spinner stops.

Very simple spin-and-move game for kids, but with little plastic apples and apple tubs for added appeal.

Name: First Wave at Omaha
Description:
ASLComp First Wave at Omaha brings the fury of Bloody Omaha to the ASLComp players in the most massive historical module yet published. This game is a historical module for the Advanced Squad Leader system.  It has three linking maps recreate Omaha West and portions of Omaha East with six feet of running map length. Every detail is there, and all of the Vierville and Les Moulins draws, scenes of the hardest fighting in Normandy and the setting for the opening scene of Saving Private Ryan, are included.

The 'three story house', Norman 'Dutch' Cota, wave after wave of landing craft, laden with American soldiers headed for their doom...or the first step in freeing Hitler's Fortress Europa.

The packet will contain mostly enough counters to play the module with player providing fortification counters, US & German concealment counters and possibly some information counters.

ASLComp First Wave at Omaha contains:

* 15 action-packed scenarios
    * 1 monster campaign style scenario that depicts the entire landing and battle inland
    * 3 linking color maps
    * 8 page variant Special Rules booklet
    * 10 116th Regimental Combat Team Landing Play Aids
    * 4 German Resistance Nest Play Aids
    * 2 Destroyer Cards
    * 6 sheets of color die cut counter
    * Color Cover sheet
    * Backsheet
    * Ziploc® style baggie to hold it all in

Name: Aqeuropoly
Description:
Aqeuropoly covers 4 continents and 24 countries.  Your musketeer (player) journeys with the aim of setting up companies in the various countries.  The end goal is to dominate a continent with large holding companies.

Players gain points by offering different services and holding companies and having the largest market share.  Players may simply build and start companies or can do a hostile take-over of other opponents companies.

Name: Rhodos 1522
Description:
Rhodos 1522 is a solitaire wargame covering the war between the Turks and the Crusaders on Rhodos in 1522. The game itself is card-driven and battles are resolved by dice rolling.

The game is free for download for print and play, however rules, cards and map are all in German.

Download link: http://www.ghs-kosim.de/index.php/cosimm/rhodosm

Name: Jade
Description:
Two players, Cross and Parallel, take turns placing a stone of either color at a vacant board point. Cross wins by connecting all four sides with a chain of either color. Parallel wins by connecting either the top and bottom or left and right sides with two chains, one of each color. Draws are not possible.

The game can be played on Richard's PBeM server:
http://www.gamerz.net/pbmserv/jade.html

Name: Tintenherz: Das Spiel zum Film
Description: Tintenherz Das Spiel zum Film is an abstract tile game based upon the film (Inkheart, in English), featuring scenes from the film.  Players move around the board, looking for matched pairs as in a memory game.  Each player takes the role of a character from the film, receiving a related special action to take during the game.

Name: Cyclisme Manager
Description: French cycling game base on peloton movement rather than on individual riders' movement.

Name: Jvgec
Description:
French cycling game, the name stands for 'jeu de vélo et gestion d'une équipe cycliste'.

This game is mentioned as roleplaying but it is more a campaign of many games for a full year.
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: Tour de France
Description: French cycling game about the Tour de France. Each player has a team of three cyclists and a series of tactics cards. Cyclists move by groups and players can use their tactics cards to help them. The race is composed of different zones like Sprint or Mountain. Race Event can appear in specific zones determined by Event Cards. Players can win on three different classifications : General, Sprint or Mountain.

Name: Die Rundfahrt
Description: Cycling game from Berlin.

Name: ElvisOpoly
Description:
ElvisOpoly

"The Rock 'n' Roll Game of Fortune & Fame"

This is a monopoly style game about Elvis Presley. Players move around a board featuring Elvis songs and collect gold or platinum records. Board spaces include Graceland and the U.S. Army.

Includes board, cards, plastic record discs, tokens, play money, dice, rules, and storage insert.

(c)1995

Name: Rukshuk:  Pagota
Description:
Pagota is the sequel to the award-winning stacking game, Rukshuk.

The goal of Pagota is to build tall towers using stones valued at 1 through 5 points.  At any time a player may bow out and take the sum amount of their points, rather than risk building their tower higher.

Name: Big Day Dice Games
Description:
This simple black felt bag comes with 2 shiny metal 6-sided dice and a rulebook for 5 unique games.  These games include:

Around the Horn = Players split into 2 teams, that line up on opposite sides of a table.  Starting with the players at one end of the table, each team is given one die to roll.  Players race to roll a 6 and then pass the die.  The first team to have all players successfully roll a 6 wins.

Face-Off = 2 players go head-to-head rolling one die each.  Low roller pays the high roller the difference in chips.  Ties are paid by both players into a common pot in the center.

Dealer's Dice = Players take turns being the "dealer".  The other players put a number of fingers on the table to guess what the dealer will roll.  If you are right other players pay you their own finger-count in chips.

Wild Ride = A push-your-luck game where you keep rolling and add up the total of the dice for your score, but if you ever roll a six you bust and lose all your points for that turn.  A double-six loses all your points you've accumulated for the entire game.  First player to 75 points wins.

12 Down = Players write down the numbers 1 through 12 on paper and then take turns rolling to cover up as many numbers as possible.  The numbers you can cover are ones that add up to the same total as your die roll.  The player with the most numbers covered wins.

Name: Aquaretto: Three Coworker Tiles
Description:
There are three different type of coworker tiles in this expansion.

The Training Area
When you earn a coworker, you may take possession of the Training Pool (if available) and place your worker there. For each trainer you place here (up to 2) each animal in your aquarium with a lightning bolt gets 2 bonus points. Also, all your animals with lightning bolts are no longer untrainable. So you can get additional bonus points from each trainer you place next to them in your main Water Zoo!

The Research Station
Can only be taken by a player when they get their first coworker. That coworker is placed on one animal tile in his water park and at the end of the game he scores one point for each animal of that type in the basin the coworker was placed.

The Technical Area
Take when you have a coworker you want to place on the tile. Immediately collect five coins from the bank. You may now move, purchase, and discard tiles from the depot independent of the stack order, but you may not change the order of the tiles in the stack.

Aquaretto: The Training Camp part of this expansion was originally released as a postcard.

This expansion was part of Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #2 for Zooloretto, which also included Zooloretto: Job Boards, Zooloretto: The Gorilla, Zooloretto: The Savings Book, and Aquaretto: The Trains.

And is also part of the german only Zooloretto News #2.

Also available as part of the Zooloretto: Goodie-Box.

Name: alea
Description: The components are colored tops and an hexagonal board with numbered holes.  Throw your top and score the number of the hole where your top stops.

Name: Onset
Description:
Dale's Woodcraft has manufactured a visually appealing wooden folding game board with 6 rows of 12 columns numbered 1 - 12 with each of the 6x12 intersections a depression to fit the marbles.  The game stores 24 marbles (12 each of 2 colors), 4 dice, and 4 scoring pegs.  Each round consists of 12 points and first to win 2 rounds wins the game.

Depending on the roll of two die, the optional use of a decreasing "reinforcement" number, and the management of the lower non-scoring columns to absorb part of the roll, each player moves a combination of marbles across the board towards and into the opponent's territory scoring points along the way and eventually blocking the movement of their opponent (unless the opponent blocks them first!).

This game involves luck of the dice along with the management of a reinforcement number and non-scoring columns to enable a strategy of movement for a fast moving game that is simple to play.

Name: Yvio: Octago
Description:
Octago is a game for the Yvio Boardgame Console. An Yvio Console is needed to play.

In Octago you move around the board trying to pick up points. The board consists of 12 spaces showing each a symbol in a certain color. The longer nobody steps on a space, symbol, or color, the more points you get for entering the space. The console does all the bookkeeping, which makes the complex scoring mechanism possible.
